sentences.english: But she did not give it up regardless.
sentences.chinese: 但無論如何她還是不死心。

sentences.english: Made a Mo for a while, really some deathless hearts.
sentences.chinese: 弄墨頓了一下，實在有些不死心。

sentences.english: But determined criminals are still managing to find other ways to steal cars.
sentences.chinese: 但是不死心的盜賊們卻還在一直想方設法偷車。

sentences.english: Found south west chicken dont lose heart, treat the families of children with epilepsy.
sentences.chinese: 西鳳不死心，找到了向南救治的癲癇患兒家屬。

sentences.english: He wouldn’t stop until he reached the Yellow River—to give up until his hope has gone.
Wait meeting, thief unwilling to give up, answer again, half body went in.
sentences.chinese: 等會兒，小偷不死心，又回，半個身體進去了。

sentences.english: Just at that time, the cat unwilling to give up returned back.
sentences.chinese: 正在這個時候，這只不死心的貓又折回來了。

sentences.english: Chet attempted to get hold of more World Cup tickets …
sentences.chinese: 不死心的格林企圖拿到更多的票。

definition: to give up/to admit failure/to drop the matter/to reconcile oneself to loss/to have no more illusions about
not to overlook, nor spare (idiom); unwilling to forgive/to treat severely without listening to excuses
to gain nothing/to end up empty-handed
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. twice then three times (idiom); fig. repeatedly/over and over again
as matters stand/things having reached this stage
unable to understand/unable to get over
